name: Revolution / The Gate of Principles
themes: principles as the basis for inclusion/exclusion
sensitivity to what/who serves the tribe
rejection of what violates the law of necessity
capacity to transform forms, not just seize power
fear: rejection / losing support for the principle

classical.hd_quote: The understanding and application of this law to maximize expansion of support.

keywords: knows when revolution is actually needed
principle must be perceived as necessary
interpretation.behavioral_axis: Won’t burn the village unless the village agrees it must burn.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Forces ‘necessity’ → looks like chaos or fanaticism.

lines.source_excerpt: Revolution has no support unless it is perceived as necessary. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

classical.hd_quote: The determination to exhaust every possible peaceful avenue for change.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Will try negotiation/arrangement before pulling the trigger.
interpretation.shadow_axis: If impatient → ‘coup d’etat that has little general support.’

lines.source_excerpt: The determination to exhaust every possible peaceful avenue for change. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

classical.hd_quote: The ability to destroy antiquated forms once the restrictions have been removed.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: When the door opens, it removes what no longer serves.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Can be ‘savage in eliminating the old order’ and scar the new.

lines.source_excerpt: A savageness in eliminating the old order that may permanently scar the new. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

classical.hd_quote: A concentration on the organization of power to clearly define authority.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Gets the tribal power structure in order so change can land.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Organizes for power and forgets what the revolution was for.

lines.source_excerpt: A concentration on the organization of power to clearly define authority. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

classical.hd_quote: Practical provisions for the needs of others in revolutionary times.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Makes sure the people are actually fed/supported while principles are enforced.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Gets so busy guaranteeing support that the principle itself dilutes.

lines.source_excerpt: Practical provisions for the needs of others in revolutionary times which ensures support. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

classical.hd_quote: An innate impressionality that transforms the fence-sitter into the committed.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Their field itself converts people to the new principle.
interpretation.shadow_axis: If over-sensitive, flips to ‘stubborn, and often fatal, rejectionism.’

meta.provenance: Primary text from Ra Uru Hu, The Complete Rave I’Ching / Line Companion page for Gate 49 ‘Revolution’, lines 1–6, on archive.org. All hd_quotes are verbatim excerpts ≤25 words from the corresponding exaltation/description sentences. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
